section.paragraph: Winner: Damien Pobel from Smile (handed out to Lucas Challamel on his behalf)
Winner: Marieclaire.it by Hachette Rusconi (IT)

ezobject:attribute.name: Tags
ezobject:attribute.keyword-string: eZ Awards, Media, eZ Conference, italy

section.paragraph: Winner: NX Consulting (NO)
Entertainment
Winner: Naviatech (FI)
eZ Conference sponsors
Marvin Charles
Winner: Francesco Trucchia (IT)
Paul Borgermans in session

As we announced in the official eZ Conference 2009 report, we have encouraged the conference attendees to give us their feedbacks on the event. We have received valuable feedbacks and we would like to share some of them here.

The conference was taken place in Paris on 25th and 26th of June and over 250 people from around the world joined us to discover the latest news and ideas in the CMS market. It was also a special conference to celebrate eZ Systems' 10th anniversary and the very first annual conference to be held outside of Norway.

The first three questions examined how satisfied the attendees were regarding 1) the registration process, 2) conference materials provided and 3) speakers/presenters. Average of 92% has answered "Satisfied" or "Very satisfied" on these questions. The survey also showed over 80% of survey takers thought the sessions were just about the right length. The most desired session category for the future conferences was voted to be developer session.

"Content Management: Yesterday, Today, and Tomorrow" by Steve Powers, Senior Analyst at Forrester and "Organizing editorial teams for success in digital media" by James Hewes, Head of International Development at BBC Magazines were chosen to be the most popular sessions. It was also great to learn that two-hour lunch break was well received and attendees enjoyed themselves, exploring the famous Avenue des Champs Elyses during the break.

The highlight of this survey was finding 80% of survey takers planning to attend the conference next year. We are truly grateful with the positive feedbacks and looking forward to organizing another engaging event next year.

paragraph.line: "I really enjoyed seeing the implementation of eZ Publish and the many different ways it can be used, either in case studies or demonstrations by eZ"
Anonymous

ezobject:attribute.name: Tags
ezobject:attribute.keyword-string: report, France, eZ Conference, Paris, event, Media

ezremote:object.name: Video summary of eZ Conference and Awards 2009

ezobject:object-translation.object_name: Video summary of eZ Conference and Awards 2009

ezobject:attribute.name: Title
ezobject:attribute.text: Video summary of eZ Conference and Awards 2009

section.paragraph: Here is a video summary of the 2009 eZ Conference & Awards. Stay tuned throughout the summer for more videos on eZ Award winners and musical acts.

node-assignment.name: Video summary of eZ Conference and Awards 2009

section.paragraph: eZ is proud to host the 8th annual eZ Conference in Berlin on the 24th and 25th of June. This Web Content Management & Digital Media conference is attended by hundreds of industry leaders and experts every year, and all web professionals, including the entire eZ Ecosystem, are invited. The regular Partner meeting is held on the 23rd.

eZ Conference 2010 has a wide but focused appeal. eZ's commitment to free and Open Source software means that its ecosystem includes some of the brightest, well-informed professionals worldwide. Past speakers have included Open Source leaders Rasmus Lerdorf ("father" of PHP) and David Axmark (Co-Founder, MySQL), as well as business and technology experts from BBC, IBM, Lagardre, Mozilla, and Schibsted.

The target audiences include: developers and customers using or interested in eZ technology ( eZ Publish, eZ Flow, eZ Find, eZ Components or PHP in general); Web Content Management professionals looking at best practices as well as new trends; and Digital Media Publishing specialists, as eZ's robust, media-ready solutions are especially counted upon for online magazine and newspaper websites. The two days of diverse and stimulating presentations are accordingly split into three tracks: eZ Technology, Web Content Management, and Digital Media Publishing.

Aside from the presentations, the conference offers many other useful opportunities for attendees. The eZ Systems team will be on-hand to discuss technical or business issues concerning eZ products. Further learning and networking will take place between Open Source experts, developers, implementors, content managers, web hosting companies, and more. There is also the eZ Awards and party, which recognizes the success of members of the eZ Ecosystem over the past year.

The conference's venue in down town Berlin provides great choices for dining, sightseeing, and culture. It is easily accessible, a central location in Europe, and representative of eZ's widespread reach.
To register and to keep up to date on eZ Conference & Awards 2010 details, visit: http://ez.no/company/ez_conference_awards
The 3 tracks of 2010
The goal of eZ Conference is to gather the whole ecosystem with the current tracks:

li.paragraph: Developers and customers using or interested in eZ Technology : eZ Publish, eZ Flow, eZ Find, eZ Components or PHP in general
Web Content Management professionals looking at best practices as well as new trends
Digital Media Publishing specialists, eZ getting a leading position in this industry for online magazines and newspapers

ezobject:attribute.name: Tags
ezobject:attribute.keyword-string: eZ, eZ Awards, eZ Conference, Fun, Social

section.paragraph: On the evening of Thursday 25th of June at eZ Conference 2009, special recognition was given to key people within the eZ Ecosystem and the Open Source community. With a full seated auditorium at Eurosites George V, the very special statuette was handed out to the winners of 10 categories.
The prize for Blogger of the Year is given to individuals we feel in particular have been blogging effectively to promote eZ. Important criterias are:

li.paragraph: The amount of posts about eZ
The quality and accuracy of the posts

section.paragraph: Nominees: Gilles Guirand from Kaliop (FR), Damien Pobel from Smile (FR), Piotr Karas from Mediaself (PL), Bruce Morrison, independant consultant

paragraph.strong: : Damien Pobel from Smile (handed out to Lucas Challamel on his behalf)

section.paragraph: The Publication of the Year award is given to a person who has written good content about eZ technology. It can be articles, case studies, documentation or books.The feedback about that content has been an important criteria as well as :

li.paragraph: Generated traffic in case web publications
Provided accessibility for people who don't know about the topic
Number of links to an article from an external site
Quality of content and impact of the publication for the community

section.paragraph: Nominees: Paul Wilson: How to import & export RSS Feeds, Robin Muilwijk: Importing and exporting word processor documents, Norman Leutner: Case study on Mobello.de, Francesco Trucchia: Book "eZ Publish 4 - Enterprise Web Sites Step-by-Step".
The Contribution of the Year award is given to the best contribution created during the last 12 months, based on:

Nominees: Varnish Control Center from Norman Leutner at All2e, Password Expiry from Xavier Serna at Microblau, Facebook Connect from Simon Schneeberger at YMC, eZ FTP from Damien Pitard at Prisma Presse

paragraph.strong: Winner: Xavier Serna at Microblau (handed out to Christophe Condomines on his behalf)

section.paragraph: The eZ Components Award is given to a person who has:
Nominees: Benjamin Eberlei, Thomas Nunninger, James Pic, Thomas Koch
The Community member of the Year award is given to the most active community member during the last 12 months, based on:

li.paragraph: Number of community postings in the forum
Regular and steady flow of participation
Ability to create interest around their activity
Number of people helped in the community

section.paragraph: Nominees: Ivo Lukac, Mike Meiers, Jean-Luc Nguyen, Georg Franz
The Rising Star of the Year award is given to a new partner that signed up within the last year and simply is the most active new partner we have, based on:

li.paragraph: Proven adoption of the partner model

section.paragraph: Nominees: Grand Union (UK), Audaxis (BEL/FR), Argentea (IT), Naviatech (FI)
The Partner of the Year award is given to the most active partner during the last 12 months, based on:

li.paragraph: Focus on eZ Publish Now and Premium

section.paragraph: Nominees: NX Consulting (NO), Netmaking (NO), Cometa Technologies (ES), XROW (DE)
The Digital Media Award is given to the best and relevant media site last year based on:

li.paragraph: Creative use of extensions and integrations
Implementation of new concepts for digital media

section.paragraph: Nominees: Marieclaire.it by Hachette Rusconi (IT), Cosmopolitain.it by Mondadori (IT), Freeview.co.uk by DTV Services (UK), Femmes.com (FR) by Prisma Presse
The Site of the Year award is given to the best site among other verticals as e-commerece, non profit organizations, financial portals and more. It is based on:

li.paragraph: Design, look and feel (value a modern and usable interface)

section.paragraph: Nominees: est.org.uk by Energy Saving Trust (UK), weg.de (DE) by Comvel Gmbh, socialistes.cat by Catalan Socialist Party (ES), gendarmerie.interieur.gouv.fr by La Gendarmerie Francaise (French Gendarmery)

paragraph.strong: Winner: est.org.uk by Energy Saving Trust (UK)

section.paragraph: The Honorary award will be given to a long and faithful member in the eZ ecosystem, based on:

li.paragraph: Who contributed the most making eZ get attention in the market

paragraph.strong: Pierre Yves Policella and Stphane Couzinier

ezremote:object.name: The eZ Conference 2009 Blog is out !

ezobject:object-translation.object_name: The eZ Conference 2009 Blog is out !

ezobject:attribute.name: Title
ezobject:attribute.text: The eZ Conference 2009 Blog is out !

section.paragraph: The eZ Conference is only one week away. More than 230 people are registered and an official blog for eZ Conference 2009 has been launched in order to keep updated about the most important discussions and presentations.

Thanks to the Global Sponsor of eZ Conference 2009, Audaxis, a blog willallow any eZ Community member, present in Paris or not, to follow some of the most important discussions. By tagging tweets with #ezconf in Twitter all attendees will be able to share their thoughts and discuss on that platform.
The blog URL is : http://blog-ezconference.audaxis.com/

ezremote:object.name: Involved in a media company working with eZ Publish? Join the Media User Group!

ezobject:object-translation.object_name: Involved in a media company working with eZ Publish? Join the Media User Group!

ezobject:attribute.name: Title
ezobject:attribute.text: Involved in a media company working with eZ Publish? Join the Media User Group!

section.paragraph: I am glad to invite eZ Publish users from the Media sector to meet and participate in the Media User Group during the conference, friday afternoon at 15.00. This user group was initiated one year ago during the last eZ conference and this will be the 4th meeting.

The goals for this user group are multiple : sharing experience with eZ for Media companies, collaborating on some shared project, influencing, contributing and strengthening eZ Publish and the eZ ecosystem as a preferred solution for the Media and Publishing industry ...

paragraph.line: For this meeting, i guess many will be very tired of the conference and especially of the award ceremony and other after show celebrations, i suggest then to have it shorter and more focused than previous ones. Let's focus on eZ Publish lifecycle and roadmap in order to discuss the last changes in eZ Systems product development, the future and how you could participate in it by shaping eZ as the best solution for the Media market ! We need your help for that !
Of course, any other idea to be discussed will be welcome.
If you're not in the User Group mailing list and want to participate, please drop me an email.
If you are in the list, rendez vous friday afternoon at 15.00, in the room Paris !
Cheers
Roland Benedetti

node-assignment.name: Involved in a media company working with eZ Publish? Join the Media User Group!

ezremote:object.name: Web to Print, Print to Web and more. eZ and Woodwing

ezobject:object-translation.object_name: Web to Print, Print to Web and more. eZ and Woodwing

ezobject:attribute.name: Title
ezobject:attribute.text: Web to Print, Print to Web and more. eZ and Woodwing

section.paragraph: The magazine industry is in a very special phase where at the same time, digital business is hardly predictable and print sales are decreasing. While many publishers mean that Digital could never get abouve 20% of a publisher turn over, it seems obvious that digital can be more than a web based version of a print brand.

Indeed having one content repository making assets available to multiple channels (web, print, mobile) can also help publishers to be more efficient overall and not only on the Web. At least, better integrations between print technology and web need to be considered.

Woodwing, well known software vendor helping publishers to improve their print process, and eZ are now collaborating. Content stored either in eZ or in Content Station (woodwing product) can be exchanged for better reuse of assets.

Johnny Thgersen from Woodwing will tell us more about that on Friday morning i the Digital Media track. I am not sure if Johnny will show us the integration but at least, we should understand better the real value of such a partnership.
It shows once again how eZ Publish easily integrates with 3rd party applications. Stay tuned !

node-assignment.name: Web to Print, Print to Web and more. eZ and Woodwing

ezremote:object.name: Want to get the best out of eZ Find and eZ Flow ?

ezobject:object-translation.object_name: Want to get the best out of eZ Find and eZ Flow ?

ezobject:attribute.name: Title
ezobject:attribute.text: Want to get the best out of eZ Find and eZ Flow ?

section.paragraph: Using these products on a daily basis? Wondering how to customize them? Hardly touched them? eZ what !?
Pick the question you best identify with, and bring it with you on thursday, june 25th, 3.40pm at the developer track.

There is, in eZ Publish projects nowadays, no way around eZ Find and eZ Flow. This talk will give you simple and obvious hints as to why they can speed up common development tasks, enforce code reuse, dramatically increase user experience, and what enterprise-grade features they bring into the eZ Publish platform.
Come and get some!

ezobject:attribute.name: Tags
ezobject:attribute.keyword-string: eZ Conference, eZ Find, eZ Flow, developer, eZ Publish, Premium

node-assignment.name: Want to get the best out of eZ Find and eZ Flow ?

paragraph.line: With internet, the publishing market is facing a major challenge by
trying to combine print and digital delivery.
How to coordinate both is a major question for them.
Today, some of the players has already made their choice and are moving
to a 100% digital media delivery. The others want to take advantage of
both media but they have to face organizational issues. Should they
merge print and digital editorial teams?
The Belgian Rossel press group has made his choice by creating a true
bi-media editorial teams.
On june 26th, for his keynote, James Hewes will explain how the
organizational aspects at BBC have influenced their digital publishing
projects.

section.paragraph: I updated the developer track page with new topics for the Barcamp & Lightning Talks section (Friday 26th, from 15h00 in the Mezzanine):

li.paragraph: Simplify your eZ Publish ajax pattern with an upcoming ajax extension (Andr Rmcke, eZ Systems)
eZ Find tips & tricks (Paul Borgermans, eZ Systems)
eZ Community site update and plans (Grenland Web)

section.paragraph: Feel free to send me additional proposals (possible until the very start of the Barcamp). The final selection will be made by the audience
Cheers
Paul
